qas.question: What year did the Everton FC release their UK pop song "The Boys in Blue"?
What position did the song "Here We Go" by the Everton FC peak at on the UK pop charts in 1985?
What was the name of the song that the Everton Football Club released in 1986?
Who originally sang the song "All Together Now" that was reworked and released by Everton Football Club in 1995?
How many times has the Everton FC entered the UK pop charts?
In what year did The Farm release their first album?
Which band released "Everybody's Cheering The Blues"?
In what year did The Farm perform "All Together Now"?

context: The club have entered the UK pop charts on <a4_0>four<a4_0/> occasions under different titles during the 1980s and 1990s when many clubs released a song to mark their reaching the FA Cup Final. "The Boys in Blue", released in <a0_0><b5_0>1984<b5_0/><a0_0/>, peaked at number 82. The following year the club scored their biggest hit when "Here We Go" peaked at <a1_0>14<a1_0/>. In <b9_0>1986<b9_0/> the club released "<a2_0>Everybody's Cheering The Blues<a2_0/>" which reached number 83. "All Together Now", a reworking of a song by Merseyside band <a3_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>The Farm<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/>, was released for the 1995 FA Cup Final and reached number 27. When the club next reached the 2009 FA Cup Final, the tradition had passed into history and no song was released.
